data.title: Vivek Khemani on LinkedIn: #aamchi #maximumcitymaximumtech #mumbaitechweek #mtw2024 #techinmumbai…
data.meta_description:
10 DAYS TO GO for #Aamchi Mumbai’s coolest techfest by TEAM to showcase the best of tech that the city has to offer. See you there!

Book your tickets now:…
data.text:
𝗜 𝗮𝗺 𝗻𝗼 𝗶𝗻𝘃𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗿. 𝗕𝘂𝘁, 𝗜 𝗮𝗺 𝗮 𝗺𝗲𝗺𝗯𝗲𝗿 𝗼𝗳 Inflection Point Ventures. My reason for joining them was simple - I am fascinated by the world of #Startups. Innovation and new ideas excite me. I am curious to know the what, how, and the why of the founder's ideas. I want to expand my network, my knowledge, and learn more about angel investing. The only way to learn is by exploring, being curious, and asking questions. And by networking outside of your comfort zone. 𝙄𝙛 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙖𝙧𝙚 𝙣𝙤𝙩 𝙣𝙚𝙩𝙬𝙤𝙧𝙠𝙞𝙣𝙜, 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙖𝙧𝙚 𝙣𝙤𝙩 𝙬𝙤𝙧𝙠𝙞𝙣𝙜. Investors have many apprehensions when it comes to investing. Attending the IPV Connect event held in Mumbai on June 14, 2024, was an eye-opener at various levels. Listening to tips on allaying those apprehensions through a scintillating conversation between Vinay Bansal and Ankur Mittal, ably moderated by Rajiv Indimath, here is what I picked up: 🔰 You need to get involved to understand this sector 🔰 Take baby steps - observe, listen, read, and learn 🔰 Experiment with small amounts 🔰 Follow your passion and interest - for instance, agri and health tech startups interest me the most because I am fascinated with the impact innovative ideas in this field can do 🔰 Get out of your comfort zone and network with other investors 𝗜 𝗮𝗺 𝗻𝗼 𝗶𝗻𝘃𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗿. 𝗡𝗼𝘁 𝘆𝗲𝘁. #startups #angelinvesting #networking #innovation #curiosity

Today, amidst the nation's brightest minds, we find ourselves in equal parts nervous and exhilarated. The competition is fierce, but the shared passion for innovation creates a bond stronger than rivalry. We learn, we inspire, and together, we paint the future with strokes of ingenuity. The Hackathon has been more than just a contest; it's been a crucible, forging us into seasoned problem-solvers. We've learned to think outside the box, collaborate like a well-oiled machine, and emerge from setbacks stronger than ever. As we gear up to pitch our project, a quiet confidence fills us. We may not win the grand prize, but the journey itself has been the greatest reward. We've pushed boundaries, unearthed potential, and ignited a fire of innovation that will blaze long after the finale. This isn't just about the competition; it's about the dreams born in Tikamgarh taking flight. Watch this space, for the Smart India Hackathon is just the beginning #smartindiahackathon2023 #GrandFinale #Innovation #dreamsdocometrue

"Thrilled to have attend the Umagine Tech Conference organized by TamilNadu! It was an enlightening experience diving deep into the latest trends and innovations shaping the tech landscape. From insightful keynotes to engaging workshops, I came away with a wealth of knowledge and new connections. Kudos to the organizer for putting together such a fantastic event! Looking forward to implementing what I've learned into my work. #umagineTech #techconference #TamilNaduTech"

🏆 A winner will be crowned this week! After four grueling months of competition across four zones in India, 13 teams have been selected to compete in the final round of the TerraTech Challenge Hackathon 2024. 🏆 The Hackathon aims to harness diverse minds, fostering creativity and innovation to enable financial inclusion. 🎥 Watch live on Facebook as the remarkable finalists push technological boundaries and open the door to leaving a lasting impact on India's financial services landscape. Join us in supporting all teams and celebrating the potential of innovative solutions to end poverty. 🎉 💡 More About TerraTech: Grameen Foundation for Social Impact (GFSI) launched the ambitious “Scaling Agent Viability and Quality in India” project, which focuses on enhancing agent viability, diversifying product offerings, and expanding the Business Correspondent (BC) network, with a special emphasis on recruiting more women agents. Leveraging cutting-edge technology and geospatial data, the project employs an innovative data-driven decision tool accessible to all BC industry stakeholders, promoting transparency, and aiding strategic planning for financial inclusion. Watch live on March 21: https://lnkd.in/dWrSgqjJ #TechInnovation #Digitalinclusion #GlobalGoalsLocalChange #GrameenInvestsInHerPower #GrameenChangesLives #GrameenEndsPoverty #EndPoverty #InvestInThePowerOfWomen #InvestInTheFutureToday

Could not find URL for " NITI for States " portal . It may sound a bit premature, but consider the following scenario : Assume that I am an officer from a State and charged with drawing up some State Policy ( on XYZ subject ) . If I visit this portal and ask / pose questions that follow , would the Artificial Intelligence search the HUGE / RELEVANT databases of POLICIES - BEST PRACTICES - STRATEGIES , and deliver to me , a Full fledged / comprehensive DRAFT ? # Suggest a suitable policy for planting trees along the highways of Maharashtra and thereby, earn GREEN CREDITS My own Digital Avatar ( www.HemenParekh.ai ) gave following replies ( - surely , " NITI for States " should be able to do far better ) : # Suitable policy for planting trees along the highways of Maharashtra to earn GREEN CREDITS could involve a comprehensive plan that incentivizes individuals and entities to plant and maintain trees along the highways. This could be tied to a system where the amount of carbon sequestered by these trees is measured and converted into GREEN CREDITS, which can be monetized. Additionally, the policy could encourage the use of native tree species to promote biodiversity and ecological balance

Mayhem at an #ongroud #event / #show. Do read this Twitter thread fully. Traffic on the roads might not have been in the control of the organizers, BookMyShow . But many other things were. Including basics of a show involving a performing artiste, like elevation of the stage, the sound and the lights. Even if one were to discount the thoughtlessness, that too for a tech company, about how would QR codes work if there's no internet! For some of us, who have run mega shows & events, these are all basics. It is thoughtless and mindless. Actually it brings us to multiple sad experiences with tech-led startups which are into Businesses that have substantial on-ground logistics & operations aspect to the business. For instance a shipping startup, which can't just work with an App and has to manage the pickups, deliveries and so on. #startups #customerexperinces #bangalore https://lnkd.in/gRse-fzC
